info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 5:42AM CDT until April 6 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Mississippi, including the following counties, Amite and Pike.
* WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Residual water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result on continued minor flooding across the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mccomb, Magnolia, Summit and Mccomb Airport. - This includes the follwing Interstate... Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 10 and 24. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
